documents.title: our live coverage across the day - and the week
text: we 've just worked out after monday , we 're going to have to wait another 91 days until our next bank holiday so we 're heading home to start making the most of the long weekend as soon as we can .

if you 're just joining us , or you 've been dipping in and out of our coverage during the day , the best way of finding out exactly what 's been happening across the county is to scroll down and bring yourself up-to-date .
have an enjoyable weekend , whatever you 've got planned , and set yourself a reminder to join us again on tuesday from 08:00 .

documents.title: weekend weather : hot and humid
text: it 's set to be a beautiful evening across the bbc east region , with fine and dry weather and clear skies , though it could feel muggy overnight .
some sea mist and fog may move in along the norfolk coast for a few hours .
tomorrow is going to be another dry and sunny one , feeling hot and humid .
cloud will increase from the west and bring the risk of a few isolated heavy showers or thunderstorms during the afternoon , although many places will remain completely dry .
moderate southeasterly winds , becoming light southwesterly by the end of the day .
highs of 28c ( 82f ) .

documents.title: fire service urges people to remain vigilant as dry conditions continue
text: suffolk fire and rescue service is urging people to remain vigilant in preventing and spotting possible fires as the hot weather continues .
more than 30 firefighters from suffolk and norfolk tackled a blaze in thetford forest yesterday afternoon .
earlier this month crews were on the scene of a gorse fire in southwold for more than 24 hours .

documents.title: wwii pacific war journal sells for £ 2,500 at auction
text: a midshipman 's diary which includes covers a first-hand account of the last shots fired in the pacific during world war two , among other events .
reached less than expected when it was auctioned recently .
the journal was expected to reach £ 3,000-£ 5,000 at diss auction rooms ' militaria sale on saturday , but made £ 2,500 .
the diary was kept by john g pike , who had lied about his age in order to join the war effort aged 16 .

documents.title: two men jailed following armed robbery in beccles
text: jail sentences totalling more than 17 years have been handed down to two men following an armed robbery at a jewellers in beccles in september last year .
kerron turner ( left ) , 26 , formerly of york road in great yarmouth , and the greenway in beccles was jailed at ipswich crown court for 10 years and 10 months .
aaron knights , 25 , of no fixed abode but also formerly of york road in great yarrrmouth , was sent to prison for six years , six months .
turner was found guilty of robbery and possession of a firearm with intent at a trial earlier in the year .
knights had previously pleaded guilty to robbery and possession of an imitation firearm .
det insp simon bridgland said : `` '' this was a frightening incident for the victim who was working at the jewellers at the time of the attack .
`` he has shown great courage throughout and we 'd like to thank him and other members of the public who got in touch to pass on information following the incident for their assistance . ''

documents.title: water safety message for people visiting the broads
text: police are reminding people who visit the broads and coastal areas over the bank holiday weekend that while a river may be a tempting way to cool off , the water can have hidden dangers .
pc paul bassham from norfolk constabulary 's broads beat team said : `` we want people to come and enjoy what the broads has to offer , but to be aware of the risks and stay safe .

`` there are many dangers that people may not necessarily see such as the change in depth , sudden decreases in temperature , unseen objects and currents , which can cause even the strongest of swimmers to get into difficulty very quickly . ''

there 's also a warning using boats : `` we would like to remind those at the helm of a vessel that there are hefty fines for navigating when not in proper control of your boat whether this is due to taking drugs or being intoxicated . ''

documents.title: the lorry driver 'must be devastated '
text: a woman whose teenage daughter died after being hit by a lorry on the a47 between lowestoft and great yarmouth on monday afternoon says : `` the lorry driver must be devastated , i ca n't imagine what he must be going through . ''
michelle whiting , from beccles , is searching for answers about the mental health treatment 18-year-old rachel stoter received prior to her death .
michelle added : `` i think that if she was in such a frame of mind that she wanted to harm herself they should have put her in hospital and they should have kept her safe . ''
the james paget hospital , and the norfolk and suffolk foundation trust have said it 's not appropriate to comment at this time .

documents.title: listen : north yorkshire school head sets off on long fundraising walk
text: the headmaster of a north yorkshire school is going above and beyond the call of duty .
stephen mulryne , from terrington hall , is walking from norfolk back to york to raise funds for a new school hockey pitch .
he 's told bbc radio york why he decided to undertake the challenge :
author: Louise Fewster
BBC Radio York

documents.title: mother of teenager who died on a47 'searches for answers '
text: the mother of a lowestoft teenager , who died following a collision on the a47 between lowestoft and great yarmouth , is searching for answers from mental health professionals , about the treatment her daughter received just before the incident .
rachel stoter , 18 , who 'd suffered from mental health problems over the past few years , died at the james paget hospital on monday night after she had been hit by a lorry shortly before 15:00 .
it 's understood she 'd been treated at the hospital the day before the collision .
her mother michelle whiting , who lives in beccles , said : `` as far as i 'm aware she was released from hospital on monday maybe half an hour , 40 minutes before the accident .
`` she was walking from james paget along the a47 away from the hospital .
`` why was n't she put in hospital ?
why were n't we called to go and her up ?
why just release her on her own ? ''
both the norfolk and suffolk foundation trust , and the james paget have said it 's not appropriate to comment at this time .
no-one has been arrested in connection with the incident .

documents.title: your photos : sunshine across the county
text: if you , like me , are stuck in the office with little chance of getting out into the glorious sunshine i hope you wo n't mind me sharing these bbc weather watchers ' photos to remind you of what you 're missing .

documents.title: celebrating women 's role in brewing
text: norwich is playing host to a beer festival with a difference this bank holiday , in celebration of women in the brewing industry .
for the fourth year , fem.ale returns to the city , with a collection of ales , lagers , stouts and porters from female-led breweries across the uk and beyond .
erica horton , one of the festival 's directors , has done a lot of research into the history of brewing and the fermentation of drinks and says women were always at the heart of the industry .

`` there 's a stereotype in more contemporary times that beer is a drink for men , brewed by men and consumed by men and we 're here to remind people that that 's not the real history of beer it 's just a liquid and it 's for everyone . ''
if you fancy a pint , get down to the plasteres arms in cowgate - the event runs from today to 29 may .

documents.title: bringing the safety message to the seafront
text: police officers will be joining forces with the rnli by opening a beach pod on gorleston seafront to support the message of safety to beach visitors .
visitors to the seaside town will get the chance to discuss any concerns they may have .
pc hannah gardiner says the town has a transient community in the summer months , who may not be aware where the local police station is .
this beach pod will act as visible policing presence for those in the area and will allow us the opportunity to offer reassurance and safety messages to our communities . ''

documents.title: dog fouling film led to fine
text: have you ever seen something going on , and decided to whip out your phone and film it ?
that 's what chris speed did ( and it helped a council in its fight against dog fouling .
mr speed posted his video on facebook , showing a woman leaving her pet 's mess behind after it had fouled a footpath in gorleston one sunday in july last year .
the woman , anne corrigan who lived in waveney road , great yarmouth , was identified and taken to court by great yarmouth borough council .
the 75-year-old was fined £ 100 and ordered to pay a £ 30 victim surcharge .

documents.title: woman not allowed to trim 'thuggish ' tree
text: a woman who cut back a tree she considered to be `` thuggish '' has been told she can not touch it again .
the sycamore is in a country park at the end of gillian lincoln 's brundall home , in norfolk .
she said the species was `` invasive '' and `` thuggish in relation to other trees '' but the council slapped a tree preservation order ( tpo ) on the sycamore , believing she wanted to cut it down .
mrs lincoln said she had asked a tree surgeon friend to trim the tree because it was not being managed properly and was affecting her garden .

writing to object to the tpo , she told the council sycamore trees could release `` as many as 10,000 winged seeds '' which once established `` start eliminating the 'competition ' through their vast numbers '' .

the council 's tree officer said her description of the sycamore as `` thuggish '' was `` nonsensical '' and at a meeting earlier today , broadland council upheld the tpo issued by brundall parish council .
author: Helen Burchell
BBC News

documents.title: remaining hot and sunny
text: here 's the latest weather forecast , and it 's all about the three `` s 's '' - sunscreen , sunshades and sunshine .
remaining hot , dry and sunny , although a little breezy in coastal areas .
temperatures hitting 24c ( 75f ) .

documents.title: contractors in fatal engineering project 'did n't have competency '
text: the hse says that since four men from from suffolk died at an excavation site in great yarmouth in 2011 , construction design and management regulations have been updated .

hse spokeswoman annette hall said : `` sadly the contractors involved in this [ the claxton engineering project ] were not really able , they did n't have the competency to take on a large-scale engineering project like this one . ''
asked whether she was satisfied with the sentences handed out by a judge at the old bailey yesterday , ms hall replied : `` sentencing is obviously a matter for the judge .
`` i 'm pleased to have received the convictions .
`` it 's been a long-running case , it 's been a complex investigation and i 'm satisfied that we 've got convictions and messages are out there about the importance of planning in future . ''

documents.title: safety measures 'were n't put in place ' at site where four workers died
text: the day after two companies were fined following the death of four men from suffolk at an excavation site in great yarmouth , the health and safety executive ( hse ) has warned construction firms must employ competent contractors .
brothers daniel and thomas hazleton , and peter johnson , all from stanton , and adam taylor , from rickinghall , died at the claxton engineering site in january 2011 .

hse spokeswoman annette hall said : `` it was a major engineering project building significant foundations for a new pressure test facility at claxtons and that involved planning how they were going to build these foundations .
`` at no point during the whole planning process did the people who were involved in it engage with the challenges involved in it and put the safety measures in place .
`` what that meant was that these four guys , very sadly , were working within a steel structure , trying to build it before concrete was poured onto it , and the structure collapsed on them . ''

documents.title: listen : bbc radio norfolk 's general election debate
text: scroll down for text updates on what the candidates , or representatives from their parties , said .
you can listen again to the debate as it was broadcast on nick conrad 's bbc radio norfolk breakfast show .

documents.title: who will form the next government ?
text: the bbc radio norfolk norwich south election debate covered a range of to including brexit and the war on terrorism .
it concluded by asking the candidates , or representatives from their parties , what they think the outcome of the general election will be .

james wright ( liberal democrat ) said : `` nationally i think we 'll end up with a conservative government , but what i 'd like to see is liberal democrats as the main opposition to provide the opposition that the country so desperately needs at the moment . ''

martin schmierer ( green party ) said : `` it comes as no surprise that the greens are not probably going to be forming the next government in britain , but what we 're hoping to see is a strong green cohort .

i think the realistic outcome is going to be a 40-odd conservative majority , but we 'd like to see a strong green cohort led by the likes of caroline lucas putting issues like the environment and public transport right at the heart of government issues . ''
lana hempsall ( conservative ) said : `` obviously i 'd like to see a conservative government and i truly believe in that .
as far as norwich south is concerned , again i would like to see norwich south voting for a positive chance and voting conservative . ''
trevor wainwright ( labour ) said : `` now people have seen the manifestos , it will certainly be a labour government in a few weeks time .
our manifesto is good , people are coming round to our way of thinking and the polls are narrowing . ''

documents.title: will national issues dictate the outcome of the election ?
text: the candidates , or their representatives , in the battle for the norwich south seat were asked whether next month 's general election is about local or national issues .
james wright ( liberal democrat ) said : `` it 's very much a national election , and brexit is by far and away the biggest thing people are talking about .

but it 's also about how national policy is implemented locally , whether that 's about school funding , nhs funding or housebuilding all of those things are local issues to people who live in norwich south , but it 's national policy that will dictate how they 're dealt with . ''
richard bearman is hoping to take the seat for the green party .
he was unavailable to take part in the discussion , and asked the leader of the green group on norwich city council to represent him .

martin schmierer ( green party ) said : `` it 's always going to be a national election , a general election always is , but because it 's 650-odd constituencies it 's always done through the prism of those constituencies .

so what you do see is that when people talk about health , they 're talking about the norfolk and norwich hospital , when they 're talking about schools they 're talking about free schools and academies across norwich , when they 're talking about public transport they 're talking about public transport and first buses in norwich , and trains like abellio .
so it 's always done through the prism of local issues , and that 's where the greens have got a really strong connection with the local area , talking to people and acting on their views . ''
lana hempsall ( conservative ) said : `` i would n't disagree with what the green candidate said , however you do see national issues through the prism of local issues .
but i would say that the party that simply has no representation in government ca n't lend norwich south a helping hand . ''
trevor wainwright is representing the labour party , as clive lewis turned down the invitation to take part in the bbc radio norfolk debate .
trevor wainwright ( labour ) said : `` this election is on national issues brexit , austerity , people 's jobs , the future of the country over the next five years . ''

documents.title: crime and terrorism
text: following the bomb attack in manchester earlier this week , we 're seeing armed police on our streets , including in the norwich south constitutency .
trevor wainwright , former labour leader of great yarmouth borough council is representing the labour party .
their candidate for the norwich south seat , clive lewis , declined the invitation to take part in the bbc radio norfolk norwich south election debate .
trevor wainwright ( labour ) said : '' there 's police on the seafront in great yarmouth , i 'm led to believe .
it is necessary because of what happened in manchester , but i think we 've got to try and find a different solution to this war on terror .
incidents occur which are tragic for everybody involved , police on the streets with guns is not good for this country .
but i come back to the police cuts 20,000 police have been cut and that 's why there 's not the people on the ground and we have incidents that reflect that . ''

lana hempsall ( conservative ) said : '' public services have had to be cut theresa may as previous home secretary has taken a very tough and pragmatic line on terror throughout her office and i think she is the ideal , and the only , person who can actually take us through what is a bit of a terror crisis for the country . ''
representing the green party view is martin schmierer , leader of the green group of norwich city council .
martin schmierer ( green party ) said : `` the cuts to policing have had a fundamental and detrimental impact on the police 's ability to deal with these kinds of issues .
in part , it 's the police and community support officers , those eyes and ears on the ground with their fingers among the community , listening to what 's going on .

they report upwards , and it 's this intelligence-led policing that can ensure we get the intelligence that the police need to deal with the problems , whether it be about terrorism or a host of other crimes that are being committed on our streets . ''

james wright ( liberal democrat ) said : `` one of the things we 've seen in the last few days since the tragedy in manchester is soldiers being deployed , and the police federation themselves are saying that is as a consequence of cuts to policing .
my party would commit to putting an extra £ 300m in to community policing per year for the duration of the parliament . ''

documents.title: brexit
text: brexit was the first subject up for discussion during bbc radio norfolk 's norwich south election special .
the conservative candidate , lana hempsall , is standing on the ticket of britain leaving the european union , so how would she represent a constituency that voted to remain ?
lana hempsall ( conservative ) said : `` the country voted to the leave the european union , and the majority of the country spoke , and that 's why we 're leaving the eu .
it will be my job as the local mp to bring the constituency along to show them that this is not a bad move , that this will work positively .
`` it will not mean a decline in jobs , it will not mean a decline in prosperity or a decline in anything this is only good news for norwich south .
change is change when things happen you can either make the best of that change or sit back and complain i have a positive attitude towards this change and i want to make it happen .
i will work to make it happen in a positive way for norwich south . ''
clive lewis , who 's hoping to be re-elected as labour mp for norwich south , turned down the invitation to take part in the discussion .
trevor wainwright is the current leader of the labour group of great yarmouth borough council , and he 's representing the party .

trevor wainwright ( labour ) said : `` the country voted narrowly to come out of europe and we just hope that the terms that are negotiated are right for the country , in terms of economics , jobs and workers ' rights .

the attitute of the labour party is they voted to come out , we supported article 50 , and obviously the labour party position is on the conditions that we come out negotiations have only just started so the labour party will be challenging the government on the discussions that now go ahead with our 27 european partners . ''
james wright ( liberal democrat ) said : '' the people had the say to start the process and they should have the say on the final deal .
my leader tim farron says we voted for a departure not a destination , and i support him fully on those sentiments .

the people i 've spoken to who voted to leave said they did n't think they were leaving the single market , there was n't necessarily a reduction in the freedom of movement - the key thing is giving people the say on the final deal and if they do n't like the final deal , an option we continue to remain .
liberal democrats will always put democracy ahead of anything else and that 's why i think it 's very important that the people have the final say . ''
richard bearman is standing for the green party for the norwich south seat .
he is unavailable , and has asked the leader of the group on norwich city council to speak on his behalf .
martin schmierer ( green ) said : `` our view is unequivocally pro-europe .

the uncertainty needs to be dispelled , that uncertainty comes form the millions of european citizens living in this country , not knowing where the future is going to go , and it comes from the federation of small businesses , the cbi , who are not sure what kind of deal that 's going to be on the table in a year and a half or so 's time .

we need to offer certainty , some sort of guarantee , we need to be unequivocally pro-european , pro that single market , to make sure that our continent can come together in a much better and rounded way than it currently is . ''

documents.title: norwich south : the key issues facing voters
text: the candidates for the norwich south seat , or representatives from their parties , were asked what they thought was the single biggest issue facing people in the constituency :
lana hempsall ( conservative ) : it 's brexit .
richard bearman , the green party candidate for norwich south , is unavailable and is being represented by martin schmierer , leader of the green group on norwich city council .
martin schmierer ( green party ) : it 's the uncertainty , why are we having another election and why have we had a referendum that suddenly we 're having a debate about .
james wright ( lib dem ) : definitely brexit , norwich south voted clearly to want to remain in the european union .
labour 's clive lewis was invited to take part in the debate but decline the invitation .
representing labour is trevor wainwright , the current leader of the labour group on great yarmouth borough council .
trevor wainwright ( labour ) : investment in schools and the nhs .

documents.title: the candidates ' pitches
text: richard bearman ( green party )
i was a green party councillor for mancroft for eight years .
i 've been very active in tackling air pollution in norwich which has exceeded the legal limit for the past six years .
greens will also protect norfolk 's green spaces from too much development and we 've loudly opposed cuts to public services , in particular adult social care budgets .
i support lowering the voting age to 16 and my experience with the youth advisory board has convinced me young people need a voice in parliament to decide on their future .
norwich is a great city and the economic engine for norfolk .
across britain the green party is calling for one million new green jobs in the renewable energy sector .
norwich could and should be at the centre of this economic revolution .
norfolk has an abundance of wind , solar and tidal energy generation potential - all we need is the political will to harness this .
the greens would ensure we invest in these new technologies .
lana hempsall ( conservative )
i believe that norwich south has an excellent opportunity to make a positive change in this general election and elect a conservative member of parliament .
i promise to be a hard working , local and dedicated voice for norwich south at westminster .
i believe the conservatives are the party that work for everyone and not just the privileged few .

i 'm a guide dog owner , mum , wife , business woman and have been an elected councillor since 2007 and i believe that gives me enough experience and wisdom to be a strong decisive member of parliament for you if elected on 8 june .
clive lewis ( labour )
i 'm standing for re-election after two years as your mp .
norwich is my home , i live here , i love our city - it 's an open and tolerant community and i want to make sure it stays that way .
i also want to make sure we have a city we can all be proud of .
that means electing someone who will speak for all of us .

as your mp i 've established a strong track record of doing just that , campaigning on the scandal of failing elderly social care , standing up for parents and pupils being unfairly treated by academy chains , working with patients and mental health staff to oppose cuts to vital nhs services and making sure the voice of the self employed and small businesses is listened to at the highest levels .
as someone who 's served in afghanistan with the british army i understand the importance of public service .
on 8 june i hope you 'll let me continue the work i 've started .
there are two clear choices in this coming election - a labour mp who will speak for norwich or a tory mp who will speak for theresa may
james wright ( liberal democrats )
born in norwich , i 'm passionate about our city and i 'm up for the challenge of representing our friends , neighbours and colleagues in parliament .
i know just how much potential there is in norwich and with the right person in westminster speaking up for our city this can be realised .
i have three main priorities - the first is ensuring that schools in norwich are given the necessary support to prosper .
the lib dems are investing an extra £ 7bn in our children 's education , increasing school budgets and pupil premium .

secondly , we must do more to build the homes we need - i will continue to campaign for the building of houses on brownfield sites , with the government stepping in if deveopers fail to act and continue to landbank .
lastly , to champion norwich 's digital economy - the lib dems will create a start-up allowance to help businesses in their early stages .
we have huge talent here in norwich but the infrastructure is lagging behind and there are real risks from the impact of a hard brexit .
this is about your chioce over your future - a vote for the liberal democrats can change britain 's future .

documents.title: meet the norwich south candidates
text: green candidate richard bearman .
mr bearman has lived in norwich for more than 20 years .
he served as a county councillor from 2009 , but stood down this year .
he 's a keen cyclist and organic gardener , a governor of a primary school and the trustee of two local charities .
conservative candidate lana hempsall .
mrs hempsall , a businesswoman who set up her first company in 1999 , moved to norfolk in 2005 .
in 2011 she was elected to broadland council .
she stood for the conservatives in the 2015 general election , running for a seat in greater manchester .
labour candidate clive lewis , who won the seat in 2015 .
after entering parliament , mr lewis was rapidly promoted - becoming shadow defence secretary and then shadow business secretary .
he resigned from the shadow cabinet over labour 's decision to whip mps into voting for article 50 .
liberal democrat candidate james wright .
mr wright , no relation to the old mp simon wright , grew up in norwich and has a background in it and computing .
he 's served as a city councillor in norwich for several years .

documents.title: a closer look at the battleground of norwich south
text: the norwich south constituency , which is seen as a key battleground in the general election , takes in the commercial area of norwich city centre as well as a sizeable residential area , from costessey in the west , the university of east anglia ( and stretching east to thorpe hamlet .
the city is a regional financial centre .
aviva , norwich 's largest private employer , has been based here for 200 years .
virgin direct relocated offices in the city , and insurance broker marsh has its main processing office in norwich .
the manufacturing industry has declined since the early 1990s .
hundreds of jobs were lost when nestle rowntree closed its confectionery factory .
now a shopping centre , multi-storey car park and flats stand on its site .
local engineering firms have weathered the storm well , and colman 's - the mustard manufacturer - still has a major plant in the city .
in recent years , the growth of the norwich research park , which is just outside the constituency , has aided the city 's growth .
between 1950 and 1974 , norwich south was a conservative seat , but labour 's john garrett held the seat from 1974 to 1983 .
in 1983 , a comparatively small swing to the conservatives at norwich south was enough to give their candidate john powly the seat , with a majority of 1,712 .
the seat 's marginality meant a 2.1 % swing to labour was enough for john garrett to regain it by 366 votes in 1987 .
at the 1997 election , the conservative vote fell by 14.4 % and the new labour candidate , charles clarke , emerged victorious with a majority of 14,239 .
mr clarke was a senior government minister , and as education secretary he oversaw the introduction of university tuition fees .
his vote dropped by 7.8 % and his majority was cut to just over 3,600 in 2005 .
in 2010 , charles clarke lost heavily to simon wright of the liberal democrats , who 'd campaigned heavily among university students in the constituency .
five years later , the seat returned to labour .
their candidate clive lewis won with 39.3 % share of the votes , giving him a majority of 7,654 over the conservatives .

documents.title: welcome to norfolk live
text: the parliamentary seat of norwich south is another key battleground in the general election .
labour 's clive lewis won the seat in 2015 , taking it from the lib dems ' simon wright .
mr wright had beaten labour 's charles clarke in 2010 .
this year mr lewis is facing challenges from lana hempsall ( conservative ) james wright ( lib dem ) and richard bearman ( green ) .
this morning all four parties will be taking part in a debate on bbc radio norfolk .
mrs hempsall and mr wright will be joined by martin schmierer .
mr schmierer , a green party councillor for norwich is representing mr bearman , who was unavailable .
mr lewis turned down the invitation to take part in the debate .
trevor wainwright , the former labour leader of great yarmouth borough council is speaking on behalf of the labour party .

documents.title: lord ballyedmond sale raises more than £ 4m
text: items from the london home of lord ballyedmond , who died after his helicopter crashed in south norfolk , have made more than £ 4m at auction .
the northern ireland peer and industrialist was one of four people killed when a helicopter came down in a field in gillingham near beccles in thick fog in march 2014 .
the collection of more than 500 objects went under the hammer at sotheby 's over the last two days .
a silver wine cistern ( below ) , weighing over 70kg and able to accommodate over 70 bottles of champagne , which was a reproduction of an original by paul de lamerie ( 1719 ) made £ 112,500 .
an unusual 18th century large george ii palladian 'baby house ' ( below ) or dolls house sold for £ 37,500 - well above the estimate of £ 6,000-9,000 .
author: Nic Rigby
BBC News

documents.title: companies fined after workers crushed to death
text: two companies have been fined and a director has been given a suspended prison sentence after the fatal crushing of four suffolk workers at an excavation site .
daniel hazelton , 30 , his brother thomas hazelton , 26 , adam taylor , 28 , and peter johnson , 41 , were killed when a steel cage collapsed in january 2011 .
the accident happened at claxton engineering services in great yarmouth .
the old bailey heard that the men were constructing a large steel structure ( see above ) when it collapsed on top of them .
claxton engineering services , of ferry road , norwich , was fined £ 500,000 with £ 100,000 costs .
encompass project management of old market street , thetford , was fined £ 200,000 with costs of £ 50,000 .
david groucott , of diss , a director of encompass , was given a seven and a half month prison sentence , suspended for two years , as well as community work and a fine .

daniel hazelton ( below , top left ) thomas hazleton ( bottom right ) and mr johnson ( bottom left ) were all from stanton , near bury st edmunds , suffolk , and mr taylor ( top right ) was from nearby rickinghall .

text: a hacker calling himself his royal gingerness has admitted two cyber attacks on the websites of an airport and a hospital .

devereux , who has short ginger hair and wore glasses and a black coat , pleaded guilty to two counts of unauthorised access under the computer misuse act during his appearance at norwich magistrates ' court .
chairman of the bench mary massey adjourned sentencing until 16 june at norwich magistrates ' court while reports were prepared about the defendant 's mental health .

documents.title: canaries do n't see farke as 'foreign choice '
text: norwich city have appointed german-born daniel farke as their new head coach - the club 's first foreign manager .
stuart webber , the club 's sporting director , said all of the staff will be supporting farke as he gets to grips with the huge differences between the english and german leagues .
he said : `` i did n't see daniel as a 'foreign ' choice , i saw him as the right choice .
it 's important that you employ someone whose style fits in with the league and the country you 're in .
`` the championship is a very different league to a lot of leagues in europe - for a start , the amount of games we play makes it very different .
we have three games a week regularly throughout the season , and in germany if they have a three-game week they actually call it an 'english week ' !
`` that 's where all of the staff at the club and myself who have worked in the championship will be there to help him .

`` it is different when you change countries - it 's a different football culture , there are different mentalities - so we know we ca n't believe daniel will arrive with a magic wand and assume he 's going to nail it all on day one .
we 'll be supporting him as a club to get used to how things are done here . ''
author: Nic Rigby
BBC News

documents.title: timeline : the last five years at carrow road
text: norwich city have appointed the 40th man to lead the canaries - daniel farke .
you can find out more on the history of norwich city here , but read on for a quick recap of the last five years .

documents.title: norwich city appointment is 'step into the unknown '
text: the appointment of daniel farke is a step into the unknown as far as most norwich city supporters are concerned .
the 40-year old was unheard of by most english football supporters until reports in germany emerged about the canaries ' interest earlier this week .
the fact he followed david wagner as the coach of borussia dortmund 's second team is significant .
wagner was taken to huddersfield by stuart webber who has since become sporting director at carrow road .
his first full season with the terriers has seen them reach the championship play-off final .
webber is hoping his latest recruit from german football will breathe new life into norwich city after they limped to an eighth place finish last season .
it 's an appointment that will be seen by some as a gamble but that 's always the case for clubs appointing a new manager .
it certainly signals a new era at carrow road and it 's going to be fascinating to see what happens .
author: Chris Goreham
BBC Radio Norfolk sport

documents.title: norwich city new head coach will make 'massive impact '
text: writing on norwich city 's website , sporting director stuart webber explained why daniel farke was chosen as head coach .

`` in our thinking first and foremost was 'who is the very best coach we can get ' and secondly we wanted someone with the personality , drive and ambition to be the best he can be while also making us the best we can be .
and that 's why daniel stood out as an outstanding candidate .
`` he 's here to coach and develop the players as individuals and within the team .
and that 's what we wanted at this club - someone who was going to come in and make a massive impact on the coaching side , '' he said .

documents.title: norwich city 's new coach was 'outstanding candidate '
text: bosses at norwich city have spoken of their delight after asking daniel farke to join them as head coach - the 40th man to lead the canaries .
sporting director stuart webber ( said : `` i 'm delighted to welcome daniel on board .
he was an outstanding candidate , and i 've spent a lot of time getting to know his methods and how he works .
when it became clear he was interested in coming here i was very pleased .
`` borussia dortmund are known for employing high-class coaching talent , and if you look at his team at dortmund they very much dominated possession and they were defensively very good .
he 'll bring a certain style and identity to us that the fans can relate to .
`` we gave ourselves the timeframe of getting a head coach in by the end of may and i 'm very pleased that we 've achieved that .
the most important thing was not rushing it and making sure we got the decision right , and i must thank everyone at the club and the supporters for their patience .
i 'm absolutely delighted to welcome daniel here . ''

documents.title: norwich city 's new coach 'very excited '
text: norwich city 's new head coach , daniel farke , told the side 's website that he is `` very excited '' about his appointment , and called it `` a great adventure . ''
`` i was really looking forward to coming here and seeing all of the people and learning even more about the club .
`` i had a really good time with borussia dortmund , but stuart webber has told me all about norwich city , its traditions and history , and i know what a great club it is .
`` the more i know about norwich city , the more excited i get .
i 'm very glad to be here and ca n't wait to get started , '' he said .

documents.title: norwich city new coach 'one of the most highly-rated in germany '
text: norwich city have appointed daniel farke as head coach .
he joins from borussia dortmund reserves along with edmund riemer , who will take on the role of assistant head coach .
the german pair have each agreed two year deals at carrow road.farke , 40 , led dortmund 's reserve team to a second place finish in regionalliga west last season .
norwich city said in a statement that farke is regarded as `` one of the most highly-rated young coaches in germany . ''
he replaces alex neil , who left the club in march .
he was succeeded on an interim basis by alan irvine for the final ten games of the season .
norwich finished eighth in the championship table this season , 10 points outside the play-off places .

documents.title: 'fight your instincts ' if you 're immersed in cold watertged nfk too
text: the rnli is advising us not to try and swim if we get into trouble in open water this summer , but to remember one simple skill - floating .

ross macleod , coastal safety manager with the rnli , says it takes up less energy , and increases the chances of survival : `` do as little as possible whether that 's just treading water or moving your arms and legs very gently , or holding onto something for as little as 60 to 90 seconds to allow the effects of cold water to pass .

`` you 'll be able to get control of your breathing again and at this point you 'll have a much better chance of surviving because it 'll give you a clearer head and you 'll then be able to call for help or swim for safety or wait for rescue services to arrive . ''
the rnli , who have launched their respect the water campaign , say 10 people died off the east anglian coast in 2016 .

documents.title: estranged mother wants to be reunited with 'brave ' son
text: we 've been hearing about acts of kindness in the wake of monday night 's terror attack at the manchester arena .
one of those who volunteered their services that night was a homeless man , chris parker , whose mother lives in norwich .
mr parker , 33 , told newspapers he regularly begs inside the foyer of the manchester arena at the end of concerts and was present at the time of the attack .
`` it knocked me to the floor and then i got up and instead of running away my gut instinct was to run back and try and help .
there was people lying on the floor everywhere , '' he said .
`` i saw a little girl she had no legs .
i wrapped her in one of the merchandise t-shirts '' .
his mother , jessica parker who 's been estranged from her son for five years said she did n't realise he was homeless .
`` he 's had a very troubled life but underneath he 's got a very good heart .
he would immediately think of everybody else and not himself . ''
a fundraising page has been set up for chris by a member of the public and has raised more than £ 32,000 so far .

documents.title: landlady fears further flooding to pub
text: a landlady from east norfolk says repeated flooding is threatening the future of her pub .
christine hall runs the huntsman at strumpshaw and had to close it for nine months last year after damage caused by flash flooding .
christine says even though it 's back open , the problem with local ditches has n't gone away and they always worry about the next time .
she wants the county council to put pressure on anglian water to sort out the local drainage sooner than the 2020 improvement plans .
`` every time it rains it 's just really , really scary .
everytime it 's forecast for torrential rain you lay awake at night worrying about it , worrying is it all going to be gone again . ''
but norfolk county council says it 's aware of ongoing issues at this location :
`` the council is working to identify ways of reducing the impact of flooding experienced over recent years .
`` the highways ditch system in the area is being maintained and recent work by anglian water has provided property level protection to the business . ''
author: Andrew Turner
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: armed police patrol norwich shopping centres
text: armed police have been seen patrolling chapelfield shopping centre in norwich today as part of nationwide security efforts following the terror attack in manchester .
although the risk of an attack is thought to be smaller in norwich than in some of the uk 's other major cities , norfolk police is asking people to remain vigilant and to report any sus activity .
armed police are also patrolling other areas of the county where there is high footfall , including castle mall .
chief constable simon bailey said : `` the public would expect us to respond appropriately to this raised threat level and the deployment of armed officers is our primary response to this .
`` norfolk is a safe county and this additional policing is about providing a visible reassurance to the public .
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC News

documents.title: arts venues raise money for manchester
text: arts venues across norwich and norwich cathedral are raising money to help support the families of the attack in manchester .
from this afternoon , bucket collections are being held at performances , events and services .
the money will go to the `` we love manchester emergency fund '' set up by the manchester city council and british red cross .
venues taking part include the maddermarket theatre , norwich theatre royal and the sainsbury centre .
the first collections will happen after this afternoon 's performance of million dollar quartet , starring jason donovan , at norwich theatre royal .
stephen crocker , chief executive of norwich theatre royal , said : `` you will appreciate that this is , in part , a personal and emotionally charged thing for me .
manchester was my home until very recently and my time there was spent supporting a thriving culture of going out to see live performance .
`` it is also the freedom to do this wholesome and fulfilling act that has been so savagely attacked .
it is so heartening to see so many performance venues respond in solidarity . ''
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC News

documents.title: hollywood revamp goes before planners
text: plans to build a glass extension onto great yarmouth 's seafront cinema could get the go ahead this evening .
the two-floor glass addition to the hollywood building would include a restaurant and a bar .
an extension on the front of the building would add 160 sq m ( 1722 sq ft ) to the complex while the entrance to the cinema would move and existing shop fronts bricked up .
the plans for a ground floor restaurant have been changed slightly for conservation reasons and would be made up of vertical glass panels .
above it would be a conservatory-styled terraced bar .
councillors deciding the application today will be told it will enhance the seafront while respecting the victorian building and are being advised to give it the go-ahead .
a public consultation has received no adverse comments .
author: Janet Harnden
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: lotus bought by chinese firm , geely .
text: lotus , the british sports car maker , is being bought by the chinese firm geely .
geely , which also owns the london taxi company and sweden 's volvo car group , will take a 51 % stake in lotus .
jean-marc gales , who became lotus chief executive in 2014 , has been trying to return the norwich-based company to profit after two decades in the red .
having reduced losses down to £ 27m last year , lotus has said it aims to make a profit this year .
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC News

documents.title: vigil of solidarity against terror
text: a vigil in solidarity with the people of manchester is being held in norwich tonight .
it 's been organised rose lane mosque , palestine solidarity and norwich stand up to racism .
the vigil will take place at 18:00 on the steps of city hall .
on the group 's facebook page it says : `` all are welcome to join and show their solidarity over these terrible attacks .
`` please join us for quiet contemplation and to show solidarity with the victims and their families .
let 's show we have more in common than what divides us . ''
another vigil is being held by students at the uea from 17:00 .
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC News

documents.title: sundown festival to review security
text: the organisers of the sundown festival which takes place at the norfolk showground at the end of the summer say the event will go ahead as planned .
in a statement a spokesman said : `` like everyone across the country , our thoughts are with those affected by the terrible events in manchester on monday night .
`` we continually review our security and public safety measures with the police and local authorities .
`` we 're proud to bring people together through the positive power of music and will carry on that tradition . ''

documents.title: tesco to drop 5p plastic bags in norwich store trial
text: tesco is to stop selling 5p plastic carrier bags in its stores in norwich .
the ten-week trial aims to reduce plastic wastage .
a tesco spokesperson said , `` we are carrying out a short trial in a few stores to look at the impact on bag usage if we remove single use carrier bags .
`` in these stores customers who need a bag can still buy a bag for life which they can reuse . ''
the cost of these alternative bags is 8p or 10p .

text: a man has been charged with hacking the websites of norwich airport and the norfolk and norwich university hospital .
daniel devereux , aged 30 , of no fixed address , has been charged under the computer misuse act in relation to an incident involving the norwich airport website in september 2015 .
he 's also facing charges involving the external website of the norfolk and norwich university hospital in november 2015 .
mr devereux is due to appear at norwich magistrates ' court tomorrow .

documents.title: second man released in hannah williamson death
text: a second man who was arrested in connection with the death of a woman from great yarmouth has been released from police custody but remains under investigation while the inquiry continues .
the man , in his 20s , was arrested at an address in thetford on sunday .
it follows the death of 21-year-old hannah williamson , from freethorpe , who died at a property in marlborough terrace on friday .
a post mortem examination proved inconclusive and further tests are due to be carried out as police continue to treat the death as unexplained .

a man in his 30s , who was arrested in connection with the incident on friday , has also been questioned by officers and was subsequently released from police custody but also remains under investigation while the inquiry continues .

documents.title: engineering firms to be sentenced at old bailey
text: two firms are due to be sentenced after four workers were crushed to death on a building site in great yarmouth .
daniel hazelton , 30 , his brother thomas hazelton , 26 , adam taylor , 28 , and peter johnson , 42 , were killed when a steel cage they were in collapsed .
the accident happened at claxton engineering services in january 2011 .
the hazelton brothers and mr johnson were from stanton , near bury st edmunds , suffolk , and mr taylor was from nearby rickinghall .
the company admitted breaching health and safety regulations , as did another firm , encompass project management , and its director .
sentencing is expected to last two days .

documents.title: increased police presence as terror threat raised to 'critical '
text: the public can expect to see an increased police presence on the streets of norfolk after the uk terror threat level was raised to 'critical ' last night .
the threat level means an attack not only remains highly likely but may be imminent .
chief constable simon bailey said : `` there is no specific intelligence relating to norfolk , however the public would expect us to respond accordingly to this raised threat level .
`` as a result members of the public will see an increased policing presence at key locations , primarily those with high-footfall and we are reviewing key events over the coming weeks .
`` military personnel are not currently being deployed , but the threat assessment is continuously under review .
`` i would ask the public to remain calm but alert - if you see anything which causes you concern , then call the police immediately .
`` look out for anything that seems out of place , we would rather investigate concerns which come to nothing , rather than hear an incident could have been prevented , '' he added .
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC News

documents.title: minute 's silence at mayor-making ceremony
text: as a mark of respect of the victims of the manchester concert attack , a minute 's silence was held at the start of the mayor-making ceremony at norwich city hall .
the new lord mayor of norwich , councillor david fullman and sheriff , david walker , were then formally elected .
after thanking the outgoing lord mayor and sheriff , the dignitaries donned their robes and chains of office for the first time .
the theme they 've chosen for their work during the civic year is `` norwich - the welcoming city '' .
their chosen civic charity appeal is the norwich integration partnership , which comprises three organisations that offer services to people from ethnic minority communities .

documents.title: job losses following great yarmouth and lowestoft colleges ' merger
text: staff at two colleges are being consulted about redundancies after a merger between great yarmouth and lowestoft further education colleges .
east coast college says it 's restructuring following the merger and an early trawl for voluntary redundancies and re-deployment has reduced pressure that could cause compulsory redundancies .
thirty one full-time equivalent posts were identified as `` at risk '' , but college management say they 've reduced that figure to 15 .
a statement says mostly academic staff are affected , and they 're working with the trade unions and staff .

however , the college has also been critical of government funding , saying that despite both lowestoft and great yarmouth colleges making savings over the past two years , they face increased staff costs through rising pay and pension contributions , and also a falling level of funding .
it says reducing staff will realise savings that will make both college campuses financially viable .
author: Andrew Turner
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: theatre 's tribute to sir roger moore
text: sir roger moore , who 's died after a short battle with cancer , performed to a packed auditorium at the theatre royal in norwich last november , as part of his uk tour .
sir roger was a unicef goodwill ambassador and , at his request , bucket collections were held in aid of the charity after his appearance .
in tribute , the theatre says sir roger was `` unfailingly polite and charming '' during his visit with a wealth of anecdotes about his life in hollywood and the people he had met there .
`` sir roger will be remembered as a talented , charismatic actor , and as a warm and genuine human being our thoughts are with his family . ''
rip roger moore .
sir roger was last here in november 2016 , and we are all saddened to hear of his passing .

documents.title: 'medieval ' boat wins gold at chelsea
text: the discovery of a 900-year-old boat in the norfolk broads four years ago has led to a gold award at the chelsea flower show .
gary breeze , with the international boat building college at lowestoft , buit a three-quarter size scale replica of the oak boat , which stands in a nautical-themed garden at the show .
he describes the garden as `` like a medieval boat sitting in a medieval boatyard sitting on the norfolk broads based on the chet boat '' .
reclaimed timbers were used to build the jetty , which is surrounded by trees and plants native to the marshes of the broads .
speaking from chelsea , gary said he did a `` sort of football kind of style cheer '' when he learned he was a winner in the artisan garden category .
`` the people at the boatbuilding college did all the hard-landscaping with me and built the boat - everybody 's worked really , really hard . ''
there 's daily coverage from the flower show on bbc television , and the bbc iplayer , all this week .
author: Caroline Kingdon

documents.title: pet cat 'deliberately shot ' while sunbathing
text: a family 's pet cat has undergone surgery after being shot while he sunbathed on the roof of his owner 's garage in norwich last week .
owner katie leader 's children were playing in the garden of their rye avenue home at around 16:30 on friday , when her little girl heard the animal , called bailee , scream .
the injured cat was rolling about on the garage roof , before he fell off and dragged himself into their garden , covered in blood .
bailee was immediately taken to the vets for emergency surgery , which revealed he had a shattered hip bone and a severe fracture to one of his back legs .
a metal pellet was also removed from his leg .
rspca inspector john jenkins , who 's investigating the incident , says it seems that the cat was deliberately targeted , and it 's likely the person who shot him did so from height .
anyone caught deliberately using an air gun to injure an animal can face up to six months in prison , and/or a £ 200 fine .
bailee is still recovering in the vet 's care and will not be able to return home to join the family 's other six cats for a week .
anyone with information on what happened to bailee is asked to contact the rspca on 0300 123 8018 .
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

text: west runton has more reasons to celebrate than just having been awarded a blue flag .
earlier this year , heavy seas unearthed evidence of a rhino on the north norfolk beach dating from about 700,000 years ago .
and several months later , what 's thought to be the lower leg bone of a fossilised mammoth was discovered .
louise o'shea , who owns a cafe at the beach , explains why she thinks it 's a really nice place to visit .

we 've got lifeguards here , we do a two minute beach clean which helps keep the beach litter-free and there 's other things , like the fossils i 'm so pleased we 've been recognised and got the flag . ''

they 're awarded by keep britain tidy to highlight the cleanest and safest beaches .

as well as the six blue flags , the beach at wells has won a seaside award .

documents.title: 'britain known to be a high target ' says former mp
text: it 's been confirmed that 22 people , including children , have died in the manchester suicide attack and many more are wounded .
the prime minister will chair a meeting of the goverment 's emergency committee , cobra , later this morning .

the conservative candidate for broadland , keith simpson , who is defending the seat he won in 2010 , sat on the commons ' intelligence & security committee , which - along with all parliamentary committees - is in active during the general election period .
mr simpson says britain has a `` very good intelligence and security service '' which has closed down and monitored lots of individuals .

he adds that it was known we were a high target , and an attack was likely - although it 's not yet known if the attack is connected with what 's going on in syria and iraq , where so-called islamic state has suffered territorial losses .

over the last couple of months , the intelligence and security services have quite openly said that what worries them is that a number of former terrorists have come home and they 're planning - if they 're being defeated there - to carry out what they see as legitimate military acts here within the united kingdom . ''

documents.title: family 's appeal on anniversary of jan hogan 's death
text: the family of a man , whose death seven years ago remains unsolved , have joined police to renew an appeal to the public for more information .
the body of 59-year-old edmund hogan - who was known to his family as jan - was found in his flat in basil drive , downham market , on the evening of 23 may 2010 .
t
the coroner recorded an open verdict into his death .
on the anniversary of his death , jan 's family said in a statement that they 're still without answers as to how or why he died .

`` as each year passes , it does n't get any easier for us a father , brother , grandfather and a great grandfather to a grandchild he never got to meet we would not wish the distress and grief we have suffered as a family on anyone . ''

det insp stuart chapman says lines of inquiry are progressing in relation to the investigation , and they 're appealing for anyone with information to contact them or alternatively , call crimestoppers anonymously .

documents.title: hawkwind wow fans again in ipswich after 21-year gap
text: veteran space rockers hawkwind returned to ipswich for the first time since 1996 when they played at the town 's corn exchange last night .
about 500 people were there to see the band , led by sole original member dave brock .

they opened with an acoustic set followed by a electric set which did not include their big 1972 hit silver machine , but did feature the watcher , written by the late lemmy for the album doremi fasol latido - his first with hawkwind .
the tour is in support of their new album into the woods , which debuted at number 34 in the album charts last week .

it 's a follow-up and continuation of last year 's concept album the machine stops , which is based around em forster 's science fiction short story of the same name - you may have seen theatre productions of it in bury st edmunds and colchester earlier this year .
hawkwind 's tour continues at the university of east anglia in norwich on thursday and london 's roundhouse on friday .

text: tributes have been paid to a man who died in an industrial incident near attleborough last week .

a family statement said james was a big part of the family - a partner to holly and father to lexi , a son to naomi , brother to alan , uncle to oliver , a nephew , cousin and grandson .
`` dearly loved and missed by us all .
he is now with his dad colin , who he lost in 1999 . ''
the family went on to thank friends and colleagues for the fundraising they 're doing , and for all the kind messages they 've received .
the tribute went on to say james was a `` kind , loving and caring person , doing anything for anyone .
hardly moaned and always did his best for anyone he will be desperately missed . ''
detectives are continuing to work with the health & safety executive to investigate the circumstances around the incident .

documents.title: suicide verdict on couple found dead on great yarmouth mudbank
text: an inquest into the deaths of two people found drowned near great yarmouth last year heard they 'd driven to a well-known suicide spot two days before they died .
the bodies of graham and jennifer slack , who lived in bradwell , were found in breydon water in september .
emergency services had been called to the scene when a bird spotter reported seeing bodies on a mudbank .
the inquest at norfolk coroner 's court heard mrs slack , 63 , had suffered with depression and anxiety .
her gp had promised an urgent referral to a mental health specialist , but the letter was n't sent on the same day .
instead , it was sent the following day and it 's thought it did n't arrive until the following week .
after the couple 's bodies were recovered from tidal mudflats , a check by their family of their possessions found two fines from the dartford crossing two days before their deaths .
their vehicle 's sat nav showed they 'd been to beachy head - the infamous suicide hotspot in east sussex .
their car was found abandoned on gorleston 's harbourside .
inside was a note which read `` if you have found this , we have jumped ; my wife has anxiety and we feel there is no help . ''
the coronoer , jacqueline lake , said their deaths were suicide .
author: Andrew Turner
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: tory 'big guns ' continue to target norfolk
text: in the last fortnight we 've been visited by the prime minister , the defence secretary , the justice secretary , the minister for digital strategy and now the international trade secretary .

it shows how much importance the conservatives attach to winning the seats of norwich south ( won by labour 's clive lewis in 2015 ) and north norfolk ( won by the liberal democrats ' norman lamb in every election since 2001 ) .
today 's visit by dr fox began at structure-flex , a company in cromer which makes things out of fabric .

the company exports all over the world and is currently benefitting form the fall in value of the pound , but it 's also concerned about the possible impact of trade tariffs with the eu following brexit .
dr fox said he hoped british companies would continue to have access to eu markets .
he said brexit would present new opportunities for new trade deals with countries where we currently find it hard to trade , because there is no eu trade agreement in place .
dr fox then spent the rest of the day campaigning with his party 's candidates in both north norfolk and norwich south .
author: Andrew Sinclair
BBC Look East political correspondent

documents.title: proposal to permanently close a country road to prevent fly-tipping
text: a consultation begins today into proposals to close a road in west norfolk in a bid to stop fly-tipping .
mintlyn wood road runs along the side of bawsey country park ( marked in red on the map ) .
king 's lynn and west norfolk borough council says the dumping of waste and other anti-social behaviour is a long-term issue in the area .
now councillors are suggesting closing the road to motor vehicles , to make it harder for people to dump waste .
an alternative route would take vehicles along the northern side of the park ( marked in purple ) .
cyclists , horse riders and walkers would still be able to use the road .
the consultation , where people can have their say , is on the council 's website until 20 june .

documents.title: duchess ' support for children 's hos
text: the duchess of cambridge has recorded a message to mark the beginning of children 's hos week .
kate , who 's president of east anglia 's children 's hos ( each ) , recorded the message on a visit to meet families at the hos in quidenham in norfolk in january .
in it she speaks of the difference that children 's hos and palliative care services can make .
each currently supports more than 360 children and young people with a life-threatening condition in cambridgeshire , norfolk , suffolk and north essex .

documents.title: minister : 'social care funding a difficult balance to work out '
text: the international trade secretary says the conservatives are determined to bring in a `` sustainable '' solution to the problems of social care funding , but he 's admitted that it 's difficult to get the balance right .
dr liam fox was speaking during a campaign visit to cromer as the prime minister announced that the conservatives would put a cap on how much people pay for social care .

`` people who 've worked and saved hard want to keep enough of their assets to pass onto the next generation while at the same time [ we do n't want to put ] too high a burden of taxation on young people who 're bringing up their own families , '' said dr fox .
`` getting that balance is always difficult , governments have always shied away from that , this government will not . ''
radio norfolk held a debate with all three candidates in the north norfolk constituency .
read full coverage with our bbc north norfolk election debate live feed .
author: Andrew Sinclair

documents.title: king 's lynn and fakenham clash at carrow road
text: norwich city 's carrow road ground hosts norfolk non-league football 's annual showpiece this evening .
king 's lynn town play fakenham town in the final of the norfolk senior cup .
the linnets , managed by former canaries player and coach ian culverhouse , go into the match as favourites because they play two divisions higher than fakenham .
there 'll be full commentary of the final on bbc radio norfolk this evening .

documents.title: family 'devastated ' at death of young woman
text: the family of a young woman who died in great yarmouth last week say they 've been left devastated by her death .
hannah williamson , from freethorpe , died at the scene of an incident in marlborough terrace on friday morning .
officers are treating the death of the 21-year-old as unexplained , and the property remains sealed off while investigations continue .
a post-mortem examination has proved inconclusive and further tests will be carried out .
ms williamson 's family have issued the following tribute to her :
`` hannah was a beautiful young woman inside and out .
she loved life and was always full of fun .
above everything hannah adored her animals . ''

documents.title: second man arrested over death of young woman
text: a second man has been arrested in connection with the death of a woman in great yarmouth .
officers were called to a property in marlborough terrace at 09:30 on friday , following reports that a woman had collapsed .
the woman , 21-year-old hannah williamson , died at the scene .
last night , a man in his 20s , was arrested in thetford in connection with the incident .
he was taken to norfolk police headquarters at wymondham and will be questioned .
a man , in his 30s , who was arrested on friday and questioned about the incident has now been released from custody , but remains under investigation while inquiries continue .

documents.title: three boys questioned following memorial garden vandalism
text: three boys have been questioned by police after a memorial garden in norwich was vandalised .
it happened at valley primary academy where the garden was created in tribute to seven-year-old summer grant .
she was killed in march last year when a bouncy castle she was playing on was blown away by high winds at a funfair at harlow in essex .
the search is on for a fourth boy too .
police say they 've been studying cctv footage .
since the vandals struck , the memorial garden has been repaired .
local people and businesses have donated plants and flowers to help get it back to its best .
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: cricket : norfolk through to quarter finals
text: norfolk clinched a place in the quarter finals of the unicorns trophy by beating cumberland in their final group game .
openers sam arthurton and jordan taylor scored 167 for the first wicket in 34 overs .
arthurton went on to score 114 and there was a brilliant cameo from debutant jason reynolds .
the swardeston batsmen scored 50 off just 19 balls at the end of the innings , smashing six sixes , as norfolk posted 310-6 .
cumberland were bowled all out for 263 in reply with three wickets each for norfolk captain ashley watson , ben coote and adam todd .
it means they 'll be away to staffordshire in the last eight on sunday , 11 june .
top drawer performance from all the @ twitterid boys today # quarterfinals # happydays # happycoach
author: Chris Goreham
BBC Radio Norfolk sport

documents.title: the debate opened and closed with brexit
text: brexit was the opening - and also the closing - subject of today 's bbc radio norfolk general election debate , with each candidate outlining his personal position on brexit and what they will do as an mp .
stephen burke ( labour ) : the guarantee is to get the best deal for everyone who lives in britain , for the many not the few .
brexit means brexit , we have to get the best deal .
james wild ( conservative ) : the people in north norfolk and the uk voted to leave the eu last year , we now need to get on and deliver it .
i 'm absolutely committed to doing that .
it 's about getting an ambitious free trade agreement with the eu , but also making trade agreements round the world .
it 's a positive vision .

norman lamb ( lib dem ) : i 'm a democrat - i accept the outcome of the referendum , i will do nothing in parliament to seek the frustrate the outcome of the referendum and the job now is to negotiate a deal that is in the interests of our economy , that ensures very strong continuing trading links with the european union as well as cultural links and academic links , protects jobs and ensures we are able to continue to fund our public services - those are the critical challenges we now face .
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: what next for cromer 's walsh brothers ?
text: boxing promoter frank warren says he 'll sit down with cromer twins liam and ryan walsh to discuss their next moves .
liam was beaten inside three rounds in his ibf super featherweight world title fight by champion gervonta davis in london on saturday night .
ryan beat northern ireland 's marco mccullogh on the same bill .
warren is the promoter for both brothers and he praised the `` farmy army '' of fight fans who made the journey from norfolk .
`` it was brilliant , they 've done their bit .
ryan won so they got a winner tonight .
`` hopefully we 'll get ryan in a position to fight for a world title , '' warren told us .
author: Chris Goreham
BBC Radio Norfolk sport
